alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 7:57AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Buchanan, McDowell, southeastern Mingo, southern Raleigh, Wyoming and Logan Counties through 830 AM EDT... At 756 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Logan to near Twin Falls State Park to near Jumping Branch. Movement was south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Welch, Logan, Pineville, Mullens, Oceana, Sophia, Chapmanville, Gary, War, Man, Northfork, Gilbert Creek, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Coal City, Mallory, Hinch, Hanover, Crab Orchard, Shady Spring, and R.d. Bailey Lake. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 40. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
